required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study Aimed At Improving Height With Genotonorm In Children Born Little And/Or Light With Growth Retardation At The Age
clinical_study.official_title: Evolution of IGF-1 in Children Born Small for Gestational Age and With Growth Retardation, Treated by Genotonorm Especially Evolution After Dose Adaptation.

brief_summary.textblock: To estimate the percentage of children with serum IGF-1 > 2 standard deviation (compared to a child of the same gender and age and without growth hormone (GH) deficiency) 9 months and 12 months after initiation of GH treatment.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Children With Insulin Growth Factor-1 (IGF-1) > 2 Standard Deviation (SD) at 9 and 12 Months
primary_outcome.description: Percentage of children with serum IGF-1 > 2 SD (compared to a child of the same gender and age and without growth hormone (GH) deficiency) 9 months and 12 months after initiation of GH treatment. 9 months and 12 months are combined.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Height SD Chronological Age (CA) From Baseline at 12 Months in Children With IGF-1 < = 2 SD at 9 or 12 Months
secondary_outcome.description: The height in SD was calculated using Sempe reference means and standard deviations for height. Change in height SD was calculated as height in SD at "12 months" minus height in SD at "Baseline".

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Height SD CA From Baseline at 24 Months in Children With IGF-1 < = 2 SD at 9 or 12 Months
secondary_outcome.description: The height in SD was calculated using Sempe reference means and SDs for height. Change in height SD was calculated as height in SD at "24 months" minus height in SD at "Baseline".

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Height SD CA From Baseline at 12 and 24 Months in Children With IGF-1 > 2 SD at 9 and 12 Months
secondary_outcome.description: The height in SD was calculated using Sempe reference means and SDs for height. Change in height SD was calculated as height in SD at "12 or 24 months" minus height in SD at "Baseline".

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Height SD Bone Age (BA) From Baseline at 12 Months in Children With IGF-1 < = 2 SD at 9 or 12 Months
secondary_outcome.description: The height in SD was calculated using Sempe reference means and SDs for height. Change in height SD was calculated as height in SD at "12 months" minus height in SD at "Baseline".

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Height SD BA From Baseline at 24 Months in Children With IGF-1 < = 2 SD at 9 or 12 Months
secondary_outcome.description: The height in SD was calculated using Sempe reference means and SDs for height. Change in height SD was calculated as height in SD at "24 months" minus height in SD at "Baseline".

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Height SD BA From Baseline at 12 and 24 Months in Children With IGF-1 > 2 SD at 9 and 12 Months
secondary_outcome.description: The height in SD was calculated using Sempe reference means and SDs for height. Change in height SD was calculated as height in SD at "12 or 24 months" minus height in SD at "Baseline".

secondary_outcome.measure: Summary of Growth Rate SD (CA) at 12 and 24 Months in Children With IGF-1 < = 2 SD at 9 or 12 Months
secondary_outcome.description: Growth rate SD CA at 12 months was calculated as:(Growth rate at 12 months minus reference mean for CA at 12 months) divided by reference SD for CA at 12 months Growth rate SD CA at 24 months was calculated as:(Growth rate at 24 months minus reference mean for CA at 24 months) divided by reference SD for CA at 24 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Summary of Growth Rate SD (CA) at 12 and 24 Months in Children With IGF-1 > 2 SD at 9 and 12 Months
secondary_outcome.description: Growth rate SD CA at 12 months was calculated as: (Growth rate at 12 months minus reference mean for CA at 12 months) divided by reference SD for CA at 12 months Growth rate SD CA at 24 months was calculated as: (Growth rate at 24 months minus reference mean for CA at 24 months) divided by reference SD for CA at 24 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Summary of Growth Rate SD (BA) at 12 Months in Children With IGF-1 < = 2 SD at 9 or 12 Months
secondary_outcome.description: Growth rate SD BA at 12 months was calculated as: (Growth rate at 12 months minus reference mean for BA at 12 months) divided by reference SD for BA at 12 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Summary of Growth Rate SD (BA) at 24 Months in Children With IGF-1 < = 2 SD at 9 or 12 Months
secondary_outcome.description: Growth rate SD BA at 24 months was calculated as: (Growth rate at 24 months minus reference mean for BA at 24 months) divided by reference SD for BA at 24 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Summary of Growth Rate SD (BA) at 12 and 24 Months in Children With IGF-1 > 2 SD at 9 and 12 Months
secondary_outcome.description: Growth rate SD BA at 12 months was calculated as: (Growth rate at 12 months minus reference mean for BA at 12 months) divided by reference SD for CA at 12 months Growth rate SD BA at 24 months was calculated as: (Growth rate at 24 months minus reference mean for BA at 24 months) divided by reference SD for CA at 24 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Analysis of Covariance (ANCOVA) for Height SD CA at 12 Months in Children With IGF-1 < = 2 SD at 9 or 12 Months and IGF-1 > 2 SD at 9 and 12 Months
secondary_outcome.description: Change in Height SD (CA) was calculated as: Height SD (CA) at 12 months minus Height SD (CA) at Baseline

secondary_outcome.measure: ANCOVA for Height SD CA at 24 Months in Children With IGF-1 < = 2 SD at 9 or 12 Months and IGF-1 > 2 SD at 9 and 12 Months
ANCOVA for Height SD BA at 12 Months in Children With IGF-1 < = 2 SD at 9 or 12 Months and IGF-1 > 2 SD at 9 and 12 Months
secondary_outcome.description: Change in Height SD (BA) was calculated as: Height SD (BA) at 12 months minus Height SD (BA) at Baseline

secondary_outcome.measure: ANCOVA for Height SD BA at 24 Months in Children With IGF-1 <= 2 SD at 9 or 12 Months and IGF-1 > 2 SD at 9 and 12 Months
Summary of IGF-1 SD at 6, 9, 12, 15, 18, 21, and 24 Months in Children With IGF-1 < = 2 SD at 9 or 12 Months
secondary_outcome.description: IGF-1 SD was calculated at each study time point using gender specific IGF-1 reference mean and SD for the CA of the child on the date of the corresponding IGF-1 blood sample: IGF-1 SD = (IGF-1 minus reference mean) divided by reference SD

secondary_outcome.measure: Summary of IGF-1 SD at 6, 9, 12, 15, 18, 21, and 24 Months in Children With IGF-1 > 2 SD at 9 and 12 Months
secondary_outcome.description: IGF-1 SD was calculated at each study time point using these gender specific IGF-1 reference means and SDs for the CA of the child on the date of the corresponding IGF-1 blood sample: IGF-1 SD = (IGF-1 - reference mean) / reference SD

secondary_outcome.measure: IGF-1/Insulin-Like Growth Factor Binding Protein 3 (IGFBP-3) Ratio at 12 and 24 Months in Children With IGF-1 < = 2 SD at 9 or 12 Months
IGF-1/IGFBP-3 Ratio at 12 and 24 Months in Children With IGF-1 > 2 SD at 9 and 12 Months

intervention.description: 0.40 mg/kg/week dived in 7 daily subcutaneous injections during 2 years

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Chronological age between 4 and 9 years for a boy and 4 and 7 years for a girl.
- Measured Height < -2.5 Standard Deviation
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pubertal signs ie: testis volume > or = 4 ml in boys and breast stage > or = B2 (Tanner)
- Serious chronic disease (diabetes, renal insufficiency, heart failure, hepatic insufficiency, neoplasia)

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

group.title: Genotonorm
group.description: Initiated at a dose of 0.40 milligrams (mg)/kilograms (kg) of Genotonorm divided in 7 daily subcutaneous injections and titrated as needed.

group.title: Genotonorm
group.description: Initiated at a dose of 0.40 milligrams (mg)/kilograms (kg) of Genotonorm divided in 7 daily subcutaneous injections and titrated as needed.

measure.title: Age, Customized
Gender

outcome.title: Change in Height From Baseline
outcome.description: The standing height measurements were performed at the same time of the day by using a wallmounted device (e.g. Harpenden Stadiometer) at each study visit. The pre-specified clinical outcomes were analyzed at 12 and 24 months.
outcome.population: FAS. Number of Participants Analyzed = Number of children with evaluable height data at 12 and 24 months.

group.title: Genotonorm
group.description: Initiated at a dose of 0.40 milligrams (mg)/kilograms (kg) of Genotonorm divided in 7 daily subcutaneous injections and titrated as needed.

measure.title: Change in Height From Baseline
measure.description: The standing height measurements were performed at the same time of the day by using a wallmounted device (e.g. Harpenden Stadiometer) at each study visit. The pre-specified clinical outcomes were analyzed at 12 and 24 months.
measure.population: FAS. Number of Participants Analyzed = Number of children with evaluable height data at 12 and 24 months.

outcome.title: Percentage of Children With Insulin Growth Factor-1 (IGF-1) > 2 Standard Deviation (SD) at 9 and 12 Months
outcome.description: Percentage of children with serum IGF-1 > 2 SD (compared to a child of the same gender and age and without growth hormone (GH) deficiency) 9 months and 12 months after initiation of GH treatment. 9 months and 12 months are combined.
outcome.population: The safety analysis set (SAS) was defined as all patients who received at least one dose of GH treatment. Number of Participants Analyzed = Number of children treated.

group.title: Genotonorm
group.description: Initiated at a dose of 0.40 milligrams (mg)/kilograms (kg) of Genotonorm divided in 7 daily subcutaneous injections and titrated as needed.

measure.title: Percentage of Children With Insulin Growth Factor-1 (IGF-1) > 2 Standard Deviation (SD) at 9 and 12 Months
measure.description: Percentage of children with serum IGF-1 > 2 SD (compared to a child of the same gender and age and without growth hormone (GH) deficiency) 9 months and 12 months after initiation of GH treatment. 9 months and 12 months are combined.
measure.population: The safety analysis set (SAS) was defined as all patients who received at least one dose of GH treatment. Number of Participants Analyzed = Number of children treated.

analysis.estimate_desc: 95% CI was estimated using the F-distribution.
95% confidence interval (CI) was estimated using the F-distribution.

outcome.title: Change in Height SD Chronological Age (CA) From Baseline at 12 Months in Children With IGF-1 < = 2 SD at 9 or 12 Months
outcome.description: The height in SD was calculated using Sempe reference means and standard deviations for height. Change in height SD was calculated as height in SD at "12 months” minus height in SD at "Baseline".
outcome.population: The full analysis set (FAS) included all patients who received at least one dose of assigned treatment and had at least one subsequent rating of IGF-1. Number of Participants Analyzed = Number of children with IGF-1 < = 2 SD at 9 or 12 months with evaluable height SD CA data at 12 months.

outcome.title: Summary of Body Mass Index (BMI) at 12 and 24 Months
outcome.description: BMI was calculated at 12 months and 24 months as: (Weight at 12 or 24 months divided by Height at 12 or 24 months) squared
outcome.population: FAS. Number of Participants Analyzed = Number of children treated. n = Number of children with evaluable BMI data at 12 and 24 months.

outcome.description: Change in Height SD (CA) was calculated as: Height SD (CA) at 12 months minus Height SD (CA) at Baseline
outcome.population: FAS. Number of Participants Analyzed = Number of children with IGF-1 < = 2 SD at 9 or 12 months or with IGF-1 > 2 SD at 9 and 12 months and with evaluable height SD CA data at 12 months.

analysis.method_desc: Adjusted for height SD at baseline.

outcome.title: Change in BA From Baseline at 12 and 24 Months
outcome.description: Change in BA was calculated as: (12 or 24 months minus Screening)
outcome.population: FAS. Number of Participants Analyzed = Number of children treated. n = Number of children with evaluable BA data at 12 and 24 months.

group.title: Genotonorm
group.description: Initiated at a dose of 0.40 milligrams (mg)/kilograms (kg) of Genotonorm divided in 7 daily subcutaneous injections and titrated as needed.

measure.title: Change in BA From Baseline at 12 and 24 Months
measure.description: Change in BA was calculated as: (12 or 24 months minus Screening)
measure.population: FAS. Number of Participants Analyzed = Number of children treated. n = Number of children with evaluable BA data at 12 and 24 months.

outcome.title: BA/CA at 12 and 24 Months in Children With IGF-1 < = 2 SD at 9 or 12 Months
outcome.description: The BA/CA ratio was calculated at Screening, 12 and 24 months. The CA was the age on the date that the corresponding BA X-ray was performed.
outcome.population: FAS. Number of Participants Analyzed = Number of children with IGF-1 < = 2 SD at 9 or 12 months with evaluable BA/CA data at 12 and 24 months.

group.title: Genotonorm
group.description: Initiated at a dose of 0.40 milligrams (mg)/kilograms (kg) of Genotonorm divided in 7 daily subcutaneous injections and titrated as needed.

measure.title: BA/CA at 12 and 24 Months in Children With IGF-1 < = 2 SD at 9 or 12 Months
measure.description: The BA/CA ratio was calculated at Screening, 12 and 24 months. The CA was the age on the date that the corresponding BA X-ray was performed.
measure.population: FAS. Number of Participants Analyzed = Number of children with IGF-1 < = 2 SD at 9 or 12 months with evaluable BA/CA data at 12 and 24 months.

outcome.title: BA/CA at 12 and 24 Months in Children With IGF-1 > 2 SD at 9 and 12 Months

outcome.population: FAS. Number of Participants Analyzed = Number of children with IGF-1 > 2 SD at 9 and 12 months with evaluable BA/CA data at 12 and 24 months.

group.title: Genotonorm
group.description: Initiated at a dose of 0.40 milligrams (mg)/kilograms (kg) of Genotonorm divided in 7 daily subcutaneous injections and titrated as needed.

measure.title: BA/CA at 12 and 24 Months in Children With IGF-1 > 2 SD at 9 and 12 Months
measure.description: The BA/CA ratio was calculated at Screening, 12 and 24 months. The CA was the age on the date that the corresponding BA X-ray was performed.
measure.population: FAS. Number of Participants Analyzed = Number of children with IGF-1 > 2 SD at 9 and 12 months with evaluable BA/CA data at 12 and 24 months.

outcome.title: Summary of IGF-1 SD at 6, 9, 12, 15, 18, 21, and 24 Months in Children With IGF-1 < = 2 SD at 9 or 12 Months
outcome.description: IGF-1 SD was calculated at each study time point using gender specific IGF-1 reference mean and SD for the CA of the child on the date of the corresponding IGF-1 blood sample: IGF-1 SD = (IGF-1 minus reference mean) divided by reference SD
outcome.population: SAS. Number of Participants Analyzed = Number of children treated. n = Number of children with IGF-1 < = 2 SD at 9 or 12 months with evaluable IGF-1 SD data at 6, 9, 12, 15, 18, 21, and 24 months.

group.title: Genotonorm
group.description: Initiated at a dose of 0.40 milligrams (mg)/kilograms (kg) of Genotonorm divided in 7 daily subcutaneous injections and titrated as needed.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of < 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), < 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.
